function.name: announceEvent
function.help: Announces a new event to the framework.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.help: The name of the event to announce.

parameter.name: eventArgs
parameter.help: A struct of arguments or an entire Event object to set as the event's args.

function.name: announceEventInModule
function.help: Announces a new event to the framework.

parameter.name: moduleName
parameter.help: The name of the module in which event exists.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.help: The name of the event to announce.

parameter.name: eventArgs
parameter.help: A struct of arguments or an entire Event object to set as the event's args.

function.name: redirectEvent
function.help: Triggers a server side redirect to an event.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.help: The name of the event to redirect to.

parameter.name: args
parameter.help: You can pass in either a struct of arguments or a list of event args names from the current event to place in the url.

parameter.name: persist
parameter.help: Choose whether or not to sort any of the persistArgs into the session scope.

parameter.name: persistArgs
parameter.help: You can pass in either an Event object, a struct of items or a list of event args to persist.

parameter.name: statusType
parameter.help: The HTTP status type to use for the redirect.

function.name: redirectUrl
function.help: Triggers a server side redirect to a specific url. This method acts as a wrapper for a cflocation with optional HTTP status type.

parameter.name: redirectUrl
parameter.help: The full url to redirect to. Should be in the form of 'http://www.mach-ii.com'.

parameter.name: statusType
parameter.help: The HTTP status type to use for the redirect.

function.name: buildUrl
function.help: Builds a framework specific url without specifying a module name. Does not escape entities.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.help: Name of the event to build the url with.

parameter.name: urlParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to build the url with or a struct of data.

parameter.name: urlBase
parameter.help: Base of the url. Defaults to the value of the urlBase property.

function.name: buildUrlToModule
function.help: Builds a framework specific url using a module. Does not escape entities.

parameter.name: moduleName
parameter.help: Name of the module to build the url with. Defaults to base module if empty string.

parameter.name: eventName
parameter.help: Name of the event to build the url with.

parameter.name: urlParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to build the url with or a struct of data.

parameter.name: urlBase
parameter.help: Base of the url. Defaults to the value of the urlBase property.

function.name: buildRouteUrl
function.help: Builds a framework specific url and automatically escapes entities for html display.

parameter.name: routeName
parameter.help: Name of the route to build the url with.

parameter.name: urlParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to build the url with or a struct of data.

parameter.name: queryStringParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to build the url with or a struct of query string parameters to append to end of the route.

parameter.name: urlBase
parameter.help: Base of the url. Defaults to the value of the urlBase property.

function.name: buildCurrentUrl
function.help: Builds a framework specific url based off the current URL and automatically escapes entities for html display.

parameter.name: urlParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to replace or add into the current url with or a struct of data.

parameter.name: urlParametersToRemove
parameter.help: Comma delimited list of url parameter names of items to remove from the current url

function.name: buildEndpointUrl

parameter.name: urlParameters
parameter.help: Name/value pairs (urlArg1=value1|urlArg2=value2) to build the url with or a struct of data.

function.name: addHTMLHeadElement
function.help: Adds a HTML head element. Returns a boolean if the element was appened to head (always returns true unless you allow duplicates).

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to add to the HTML head section.

parameter.name: blockDuplicate
parameter.help: Checks for *exact* duplicates using the text if true. Does not check if false (default behavior).

parameter.name: blockDuplicateCheckString
parameter.help: The check string to use if blocking duplicates is selected. Defaults to 'arguments.text' if not defined.

function.name: addHTMLBodyElement
function.help: Adds a HTML body element. Returns a boolean if the element was appened to boyd (always returns true unless you allow duplicates).

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to add to the HTML body section.

parameter.name: blockDuplicate
parameter.help: Checks for *exact* duplicates using the text if true. Does not check if false (default behavior).

parameter.name: blockDuplicateCheckString
parameter.help: The check string to use if blocking duplicates is selected. Defaults to 'arguments.text' if not defined.

function.name: addHTTPHeaderByName
function.help: Adds a HTTP header by name/value.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name for the header.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value for the header.

function.name: addHTTPHeaderByStatus
function.help: Adds a HTTP header by statusCode/statusText.

parameter.name: statuscode
parameter.help: The numeric statuscode to send as a header. Standard status codes do not need text as the framework will look them up.

parameter.name: statustext
parameter.help: The text for this statuscode.

function.name: uploadFile
function.help: Wrapper for CFFILE action=upload to better integrate uploading files.

parameter.name: fileField
parameter.help: The name of the field in the 'form' scope. This cannot be the name in the Event object due to how CFFILE works on CFML engines.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: The full destination path to store the uploaded file. This must be a full path.

parameter.name: nameConflict
parameter.help: The action to take if there is a file name conflict.

parameter.name: accept
parameter.help: Accepts a list or array of mixed MIME types or file extensions (which must start with an '.').

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: For *nix operating systems only, the octal value to apply to the file for file permissiones such as read, write and execute.

parameter.name: fileAttributes
parameter.help: For Windows operatins systems only, the file attributes to set for the file (comma-delimited).

function.name: resolveValueByEnvironment
function.help: Resolves a value by deployed environment name or group (explicit environment names are searched first then groups then default).

parameter.name: environmentValues
parameter.help: A struct of environment values. Key prefixed with 'group:' are treated as groups and keys can contain ',' to indicate multiple environments names or groups.

parameter.name: defaultValue
parameter.help: A default value to provide if no environment is found. An exception will be thrown if no 'defaultValue' is provide and no value can be resolved.

function.name: setParameter
function.help: Sets a configuration parameter.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The parameter name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The parameter value.

function.name: getParameter
function.help: Gets a configuration parameter value, or a default value if not defined.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The parameter name.

parameter.name: defaultValue
parameter.help: The default value to return if the parameter is not defined. Defaults to a blank string.

function.name: isParameterDefined
function.help: Checks to see whether or not a configuration parameter is defined.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The parameter name.

function.name: setParameters
function.help: Sets the full set of configuration parameters for the component.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.help: Struct to set as parameters.

function.name: getParameters
function.help: Gets the full set of configuration parameters for the component.

function.name: getParameterNames
function.help: Returns a comma delimited list of parameter names.

function.name: setProperty
function.help: Sets the specified property - this is just a shortcut for getPropertyManager().setProperty()

parameter.name: propertyName
parameter.help: The name of the property to set.

parameter.name: propertyValue
parameter.help: The value to store in the property.

function.name: getProperty
function.help: Gets the specified property - this is just a shortcut for getPropertyManager().getProperty()

parameter.name: propertyName
parameter.help: The name of the property to return.

parameter.name: defaultValue
parameter.help: The default value to use if the requested property is not defined.

function.name: isPropertyDefined
function.help: Checks if property name is defined in the properties - this is just a shortcutfor getPropertyManager().isPropertyDefined(). Does NOT check a parent.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The named of the property to check if it is defined.
